content.title: Samples are analyzed on the Beckman DU-70 Spectrophotometer

steps.description: A flow cell with a slanted bottom, drain, and bubble trap is used in reading the samples. This must be cleaned with a potassium dichromate solution using a syringe to carefully fill the cell. Coat for several hours, rinse well with distilled water, and store in distilled water.

Push power button on and idle button. When SELF TEST stops flashing, cut UV and VIS lamps on. Attach a clean cell. Set on multi 'X'. Enter wavelengths: 314 and 310. Set FILL TIME for 45 seconds. Set AUTO ZERO on None using the (Select) button. Enter 50 for number of samples.

Fill half the batch sampler with test tubes of isopropyl alcohol, or finish filling samples from the previous run with alcohol. Fill the first 5 test tubes with distilled water in order to flush the cell.
